relationships.reasoning: Aatrox is commonly played in the Top lane due to his fighter/tank nature.
Aatrox's Q, The Darkin Blade, knocks up enemies hit on the edge.
Aatrox's passive Deathbringer Stance, E Umbral Dash's passive, and R World Ender all provide significant self-healing, making him a high sustain champion.
Aatrox's E, Umbral Dash, provides a dash, and his R, World Ender, grants bonus movement speed.
Aatrox's W, Infernal Chains, pulls enemies back to the center if they do not leave the impact area, effectively countering dashes within that zone.
Aatrox's kit heavily relies on self-healing for survivability, making him weak to Grievous Wounds.
Ahri is traditionally played in the Mid Lane due to her burst damage, mobility, and crowd control.
Ahri's Spirit Rush (R) provides multiple dashes, and Fox-Fire (W) grants a movement speed boost.
Ahri's Charm (E) instantly stops movement abilities and dashes of targets hit.
Ahri's passive, Essence Theft, heals her significantly when she strikes 9 enemies with abilities.
Ahri's Essence Theft passive provides significant healing, making her vulnerable to Grievous Wounds effects.
Ahri's reliance on Spirit Rush for repositioning makes her vulnerable to other Anti-Dash abilities that can trap her.
Akali is a common and effective Mid laner due to her assassin playstyle.
Akali's Twilight Shroud (W) grants her invisibility.
Akali has multiple dashes with Shuriken Flip (E) and Perfect Execution (R).
Akali is a highly mobile champion, making her vulnerable to champions with anti-dash abilities.
Akshan is a Marksman/Assassin champion frequently played in the Mid lane.
Akshan can also be played as a Marksman in the Bot lane.
Akshan's W, Going Rogue, grants him camouflage.
Akshan has multiple mobility tools including bonus move speed from his passive and Q, camouflage move speed from W, and a grappling hook swing from E.
Akshan's ultimate, Comeuppance, deals damage based on the target's missing health.
Akshan's camouflage can be countered by True Sight.
Akshan's Heroic Swing (E) is a high-mobility dash-like ability that can be interrupted by abilities that stop movement or dashes.
Alistar is primarily played as a Support champion.
Pulverize knocks enemies up and Headbutt knocks enemies back.
Unbreakable Will cleanses all disabling effects and makes him unstoppable.
Triumphant Roar (passive) provides significant healing for himself and nearby allies.
Alistar's High Sustain makes him vulnerable to healing reduction.
Amumu's kit, featuring strong crowd control and AoE damage, makes him a highly effective jungler.
Amumu's Despair (W) deals magic damage based on the target's maximum Health.
Amumu's Bandage Toss (Q), his primary engagement, is a projectile that can be blocked.
Anivia is a control mage commonly played in the mid lane.
Anivia's kit provides strong zone control and crowd control, making her viable as a support.
Anivia's Crystallize (W) creates an impassable wall that blocks movement and dashes.
Anivia's Flash Frost (Q) is a key projectile ability that can be blocked by projectile blocking mechanics.
Annie is primarily played as a burst mage in the mid lane due to her strong lane presence and area-of-effect stun.
Annie's Molten Shield provides a significant defensive buffer, making her vulnerable to abilities that destroy shields.
Annie's Disintegrate (Q) is a projectile that is crucial for her damage, stun stacking, and farming, making her vulnerable to projectile blocking abilities.
Aphelios is classified as a Marksman, which typically plays in the Bot lane.
Aphelios' Severum weapon provides healing through its basic attacks and its ultimate ability bonus, contributing to high sustain.
Champions with High Sustain, like Aphelios with his Severum weapon, are weak to Grievous Wounds effects that reduce healing.
Ashe is primarily played as a Marksman in the Bot lane.
Ashe's Hawkshot (E) sends forth a hawk to grant vision anywhere on the map, revealing units in brush.
Ashe's primary damage and crowd control abilities like Volley (W) and Enchanted Crystal Arrow (R) are projectiles, making her vulnerable to abilities that block projectiles.
Aurelion Sol is a mage champion typically played in the mid lane.
Aurelion Sol's Comet of Legend (E) allows him to fly long distances, providing high mobility.
Aurelion Sol's Comet of Legend provides high mobility, making him vulnerable to abilities that can stop or prevent dashes.
Azir is primarily played in the Mid lane as a mage.
Azir's Shifting Sands (E) allows him to dash to Sand Soldiers, providing high mobility for repositioning.
Azir's Emperor's Divide (R) knocks back enemies, which is a form of displacement similar to a knock up.
Azir's Emperor's Divide (R) creates a wall that blocks enemy paths and can stop dashes.
Azir, having high mobility with his Shifting Sands (E), is weak to champions with anti-dash mechanics.
Bard's primary role is Support, as indicated by his tags and kit focused on assisting allies.
Bard's Caretaker's Shrine (W) provides significant healing to allies, contributing to sustain.
Bard's Magical Journey (E) allows him and his allies to traverse terrain quickly, granting high mobility.
Bard's Caretaker's Shrine provides healing, making him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds which reduce healing effectiveness.
Bard's Magical Journey provides high mobility, which can be countered by abilities that restrict or block movement.
Blitzcrank is primarily played as a Support due to his crowd control and ability to initiate fights.
Static Field destroys enemy shields.
Power Fist applies a knock up effect on his next attack.
Rocket Grab stops enemy movement and can interrupt dashes.
Blitzcrank's Mana Barrier passive shield makes him vulnerable to Shield Reave effects.
Blitzcrank's Rocket Grab, his primary engagement tool, is a projectile and can be blocked.
Brand is frequently played as a Support due to his high burst damage and crowd control.
Brand's passive, Blaze, deals a percentage of the target's maximum health when it detonates at max stacks.
Brand's Sear (Q) and Pyroclasm (R) are projectiles that can be blocked by abilities like Wind Wall.
Braum is primarily played as a Support.
Unbreakable (E) intercepts and destroys enemy missiles.
Glacial Fissure (R) knocks up enemies.
Caitlyn is a Marksman champion typically played in the Bot lane.
Yordle Snap Trap reveals trapped targets, and Ace in the Hole grants True Sight on its target during the channel.
90 Caliber Net allows Caitlyn to dash backwards, providing a mobility tool for repositioning.
Yordle Snap Trap immobilizes enemies, effectively stopping dashes within its area.
Caitlyn's ultimate ability, Ace in the Hole, can be intercepted by other enemy champions, similar to being blocked by a projectile block mechanic.
Camille is commonly played in the Top lane due to her strong dueling and split-pushing potential.
Camille's Hookshot (E) provides significant mobility, allowing her to dash across terrain and engage or disengage.
Camille's Tactical Sweep (W) deals bonus damage based on target's max health, and The Hextech Ultimatum (R) deals bonus magic damage based on target's current health.
Camille's Hookshot (E) stuns (knocks up) enemies upon landing, and The Hextech Ultimatum (R) knocks away nearby enemies.
Camille's Hextech Ultimatum (R) traps an enemy champion in an area from which they cannot escape by any means, effectively stopping dashes within that area.
Champions with high mobility like Camille are often weak to abilities that stop dashes or restrict movement.
Cassiopeia is a mage champion typically played in the Mid lane.
Cassiopeia's Miasma (W) grounds enemies, preventing them from using movement abilities like dashes.
Cassiopeia's Twin Fang (E) heals her for a percentage of damage dealt to poisoned targets on a very low cooldown, allowing for high sustain in combat.
Cassiopeia's primary healing from Twin Fang is significantly reduced by Grievous Wounds.
Cho'Gath is commonly played in the top lane due to his tankiness and sustain.
Carnivore recovers Health and Mana on unit kill, providing sustain.
High sustain from Carnivore is countered by Grievous Wounds.
Rupture knocks up enemies.
Vorpal Spikes deal damage based on the target's max Health.
Corki is typically played as a Marksman in the Bot lane.
Phosphorus Bomb reveals enemy units in an area.
Valkyrie is a dash ability, and The Package passive grants significant movement speed and an empowered dash.
Empowered Valkyrie (Special Delivery) knocks aside enemies.
Corki's primary abilities like Phosphorus Bomb and Missile Barrage are projectiles that can be blocked.
Corki's primary escape and engagement tool, Valkyrie, is a dash, making him vulnerable to anti-dash abilities.
Darius is commonly played in the Top lane due to his fighter/tank capabilities.
Darius's Decimate (Q) heals him for a percentage of his missing health per enemy champion and large monster hit by the outer edge of the ability.
Darius's Apprehend (E) pulls enemies and briefly knocks them up.
Darius's Decimate (Q) provides significant in-combat healing, making him vulnerable to effects that reduce healing.
Diana is commonly played as a burst mage/assassin in the Mid lane due to her mobility and damage.
Her Q (Crescent Strike) afflicts enemies with Moonlight, which reveals them if they are not stealthed.
Her E (Lunar Rush) allows for repeated dashes when used on targets marked with Moonlight, providing high mobility.
Her W (Pale Cascade) grants her a temporary shield, making her vulnerable to abilities that destroy shields.
As a champion with high mobility from her E (Lunar Rush), Diana is susceptible to abilities that stop dashes or restrict movement.
Draven is a Marksman champion primarily played in the Bot lane.
Draven's Blood Rush (W) grants a significant movement speed buff that can be refreshed by catching Spinning Axes, providing high mobility.
Draven's Stand Aside (E) knocks enemies aside, which is a form of displacement.
Draven's primary damage source is his auto attacks and ultimate, both of which are projectiles that can be blocked.
Draven's reliance on Blood Rush (W) for high mobility makes him vulnerable to abilities that stop movement or dashes.
Dr. Mundo is commonly played as a Jungler due to his sustain and ability to clear camps efficiently.
Dr. Mundo is commonly played as a Top Laner due to his tankiness and regeneration capabilities.
Dr. Mundo's passive, W, and ultimate provide significant health regeneration and healing, making him very durable.
Dr. Mundo's passive, 'Goes Where He Pleases', resists the first immobilizing effect, making him momentarily unstoppable.
Dr. Mundo's Q, 'Infected Bonesaw', deals damage based on the target's current health.
Dr. Mundo relies heavily on his healing for survival, making him vulnerable to effects that reduce healing.
Ekko is often played in the Mid lane due to his assassin playstyle and mobility.
Ekko's Phase Dive (E) allows him to dash and blink, his passive grants bonus movement speed, and his ultimate (R) teleports him, providing high mobility.
Ekko's W passive deals bonus magic damage based on the target's missing health.
Ekko's primary engagement and escape tools are dashes, making him vulnerable to anti-dash abilities.
Elise's kit, including her Rappel for terrain traversal and burst damage, makes her an effective Jungler.
Cocoon (Human E) reveals enemies if they are not stealthed.
Rappel (Spider E) allows Elise to become untargetable and quickly move to a target or terrain.
Neurotoxin (Human Q) deals damage based on the target's current health, and Venomous Bite (Spider Q) deals damage based on the target's missing health.
Elise's primary crowd control ability, Cocoon (Human E), is a projectile that can be blocked.
Evelynn is an assassin champion primarily played in the jungle role.
Evelynn's passive, Demon Shade, grants her Camouflage after level 6, providing invisibility.
Evelynn's passive, Demon Shade, provides health regeneration when she is out of combat and low on health.
Evelynn's E ability, Whiplash, deals magic damage based on the target's maximum health.
Evelynn's sustain from Demon Shade makes her vulnerable to abilities that apply Grievous Wounds.
Evelynn's Camouflage (invisibility) can be nullified by effects that grant True Sight.
Ezreal is primarily played as an Attack Damage Carry (Marksman) in the bot lane.
Ezreal's Arcane Shift (E) allows him to teleport, providing high mobility.
Ezreal relies on Arcane Shift for positioning, making him vulnerable to champions with Anti-Dash mechanics.
Ezreal's primary damage comes from skill shots like Mystic Shot (Q) and Essence Flux (W), making him weak to projectile blocking abilities.
Fiddlesticks is listed with the 'Support' tag, indicating it can play in this role.
Fiddlesticks' Bountiful Harvest (W) is a channeled ability that drains health from multiple enemies, providing significant self-healing and making sustain a core part of its kit.
Fiddlesticks relies heavily on the healing from Bountiful Harvest (W) for survival, which is directly countered by Grievous Wounds effects.
Fiora is a melee bruiser commonly played in the top lane.
Riposte (W) parries all incoming damage and disables for a short time, effectively ignoring crowd control.
Riposte (W) stuns the enemy if Fiora blocks an immobilizing effect, which can include dashes.
Riposte (W) parries all incoming damage, including auto-attacks.
Grand Challenge (R) deals true damage based on the target's maximum health.
Grand Challenge (R) provides significant healing to Fiora and allies if all Vitals are struck or the target dies.
Lunge (Q) is a dash, and her passive provides movement speed.
Fiora's Grand Challenge (R) provides significant healing, making her vulnerable to Grievous Wounds.
Fiora has high mobility with her Lunge (Q) and passive, making her vulnerable to abilities that stop dashes.
Fizz is primarily played in the Mid lane due to his assassin playstyle and burst damage.
Playful / Trickster (E) makes Fizz untargetable, effectively making him immune to crowd control and damage.
Urchin Strike (Q) and Playful / Trickster (E) provide Fizz with multiple dashes and jumps.
Chum the Waters (R) applies True Sight to the attached target.
Chum the Waters (R) knocks up the target champion and nearby enemies.
Fizz heavily relies on his mobility from Urchin Strike (Q) and Playful / Trickster (E); abilities that stop dashes can limit his effectiveness.
Galio is commonly played as a Mid lane champion.
Galio's Justice Punch (E) and Hero's Entrance (R) both provide Knock Up effects.
Galio's Shield of Durand (W) passive grants him a magic shield, making him vulnerable to Shield Reave effects.
Gangplank is primarily played as a Fighter in the Top lane.
Remove Scurvy (W) restores a significant amount of health, especially with missing health scaling.
Remove Scurvy (W) removes all disabling effects, making him briefly unstoppable.
Gangplank's Remove Scurvy (W) provides high sustain, making him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds effects.
Garen is primarily played as a solo laner in the Top lane due to his durability and sustained damage.
Garen's passive Perseverance grants significant health regeneration when out of combat, allowing him to sustain in lane.
Garen's ultimate, Demacian Justice, deals true damage based on the target's missing health, which is a form of percent HP damage.
Garen's passive healing, which is a core part of his sustain, is significantly reduced by Grievous Wounds effects.
Gnar is commonly played as a Top Laner due to his strong lane presence and scaling.
Mini Gnar's Hyper (W) deals bonus magic damage based on target's max health.
Mini Gnar's Hop (E) provides a leap, and Hyper (W) grants bonus movement speed.
Gnar, especially in his Mini form, relies on high mobility from Hop (E) and Hyper (W) for positioning and kiting, making him vulnerable to anti-dash abilities.
Gragas is a versatile champion often played in the Jungle due to his strong ganking potential.
Gragas can be played in the Top lane as a tank or bruiser.
Gragas's Drunken Rage (W) deals bonus magic damage equal to a percentage of the target's maximum health.
Gragas's Body Slam (E) knocks up enemies he collides with, and Explosive Cask (R) knocks enemies away from the impact zone.
Graves is commonly played in the jungle role.
Quickdraw (E) allows Graves to dash, providing high mobility.
Graves' primary damage source comes from his basic attacks and abilities (Q, R), which are all projectiles, making him vulnerable to projectile blocking abilities.
Graves' Quickdraw (E) provides high mobility through a dash, making him vulnerable to abilities that can stop or prevent dashes.
Gwen is primarily played in the Top lane as a Fighter.
Gwen's passive, A Thousand Cuts, deals bonus magic damage based on the target's health.
Gwen's passive, A Thousand Cuts, heals her for a portion of the damage dealt to champions, providing significant sustain.
Gwen's E, Skip 'n Slash, is a dash that provides combat mobility, further enhanced by its cooldown refund on hit.
Gwen's significant healing from A Thousand Cuts makes her vulnerable to Grievous Wounds effects.
Hecarim is primarily played in the Jungle role.
Spirit of Dread (W) grants Hecarim healing based on damage dealt by him and his allies to affected enemies, providing high sustain.
Devastating Charge (E) grants Hecarim a significant burst of movement speed and Onslaught of Shadows (R) allows for long-distance charges.
Devastating Charge (E) causes Hecarim's next attack to knock back the target.
Hecarim's Spirit of Dread (W) provides high sustain, making him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds effects.
Hecarim relies on his high mobility from Devastating Charge (E) and Onslaught of Shadows (R) to engage, making him vulnerable to anti-dash abilities.
Heimerdinger is primarily played as a mage in the mid lane due to his strong zone control and sustained damage from turrets.
Heimerdinger can be played as a support due to his crowd control from E and ability to zone enemies with turrets.
Illaoi is primarily played in the Top lane due to her fighter/tank characteristics and area control.
Illaoi's passive, Prophet of an Elder God, allows her tentacles to heal her when they damage enemy champions, providing significant sustain in combat.
Illaoi's Harsh Lesson (W) deals additional physical damage based on the target's maximum health.
Illaoi's significant healing from her tentacles makes her vulnerable to Grievous Wounds, which reduces incoming healing.
Irelia is commonly played in the Top lane.
Irelia is also commonly played in the Mid lane.
Bladesurge (Q) has resets on marked or low health targets, granting high mobility.
Defiant Dance (W) is not interrupted by crowd control, making her unstoppable during the channel.
As a champion with high mobility from dashes, Irelia is weak to anti-dash mechanics.
Ivern's primary role is Support, as indicated by his tags.
Daisy, Ivern's ultimate summon, can Knock Up enemies with her shockwave.
Ivern's Triggerseed (E) provides shields to allies, making him vulnerable to Shield Reave effects.
Janna's primary role is Support, as indicated by her tags.
Howling Gale and Monsoon both knock up/back enemies.
Janna's Zephyr passive and Tailwind passive grant her and nearby allies bonus movement speed, indicating high mobility.
Janna's ultimate, Monsoon, provides significant healing to nearby allies over its duration.
Janna's High Sustain from Monsoon makes her weak to Grievous Wounds.
Janna's Eye of the Storm provides shields, making her weak to Shield Reave effects.
Jarvan IV is a strong early-game Jungler with good ganking potential using his flag and drag combo.
Jarvan IV's Dragon Strike (Q) combined with Demacian Standard (E) knocks up enemies in its path.
Jarvan IV achieves high mobility through his Dragon Strike (Q) pulling him to Demacian Standard (E) and his ultimate Cataclysm (R) providing a leap.
Jarvan IV's Golden Aegis (W) provides a shield, making him vulnerable to champions with Shield Reave mechanics.
Jarvan IV relies on his Q+E combo and R to engage and move, making him susceptible to Anti-Dash abilities that can disrupt his mobility.
Jax's Leap Strike allows him to dash to a target, providing high mobility.
Jax's Counter Strike allows him to dodge all incoming basic attacks.
Jax's primary engagement and escape tool, Leap Strike, makes him vulnerable to anti-dash effects.
Jayce is commonly played as a bruiser/fighter in the top lane.
Hextech Capacitor grants movement speed on stance swap, and Acceleration Gate provides bonus movement speed.
Thundering Blow (E in Hammer Stance) knocks back the target.
Jayce's Shock Blast (Q in Cannon Stance) is a crucial projectile ability that can be blocked.
Jhin is primarily played as an AD Carry in the Bot lane, indicated by his 'Marksman' tag.
Jhin's ultimate ability, Curtain Call, deals execute damage based on the target's missing health, and his passive's final shot also deals bonus execute damage.
Jhin relies heavily on his basic attacks and all of his damaging abilities are projectiles, making him vulnerable to abilities that block projectiles.
Jinx is a Marksman, primarily played in the Bot lane.
Jinx's Zap! (W) reveals the first enemy hit.
Jinx's Super Mega Death Rocket! (R) deals damage based on missing Health.
Jinx's Flame Chompers! (E) root enemy champions in place, stopping dashes.
Jinx's primary damage sources (auto-attacks, Zap!, Super Mega Death Rocket!) are all projectiles and can be blocked.
Kai'Sa is primarily played as a Marksman in the Bot lane.
Her W, Void Seeker, grants True Sight of the first enemy hit.
Her E, Supercharge, grants Invisibility when evolved.
Her E, Supercharge, grants Move Speed, and her R, Killer Instinct, is a dash.
Due to her High Mobility from E and R, Kai'Sa is vulnerable to abilities that stop or prevent dashes.
Kalista is primarily played as a Marksman in the Bot lane.
Martial Poise allows Kalista to lunge after every basic attack or Pierce, giving her high mobility.
Sentinel's active reveals champions, granting true sight.
Sentinel's passive deals bonus magic damage based on the target's max health.
Fate's Call allows her Oathsworn to knock back enemies upon dashing into them.
Kalista's mobility is reliant on her dashes, making her vulnerable to effects that stop dashes.
Karma is primarily played as a Support.
Karma's Focused Resolve (W) reveals targeted enemies, providing true sight.
Karma's Inspire (E) and Mantra Empowered Inspire provide significant shields to allies, making her susceptible to Shield Reave mechanics.
Karthus is primarily played as a Mid lane mage, utilizing his strong area-of-effect damage and global ultimate.
Karthus is also played as a jungler due to his efficient camp clearing with Lay Waste and global pressure from Requiem.
Kassadin is primarily played as a Mid lane mage assassin.
Kassadin's ultimate ability, Riftwalk, allows him to teleport to nearby locations, providing high mobility.
Kassadin's Null Sphere grants him a temporary magic shield, making him vulnerable to shield reave effects.
Kassadin relies heavily on his Riftwalk (teleport) for engagement and escape, making him vulnerable to anti-dash mechanics.
Katarina is typically played as a burst assassin in the mid lane.
Katarina's Shunpo (E) allows her to blink and reset its cooldown by picking up daggers, providing significant mobility.
Katarina's Death Lotus (R) applies Grievous Wounds, reducing enemy healing.
Katarina relies heavily on her Shunpo (E) for repositioning and damage, making her vulnerable to abilities that stop dashes.
Katarina's Death Lotus (R) is a channeled ability that is easily interrupted by hard crowd control like knock ups.
Katarina's Bouncing Blade (Q) and Death Lotus (R) both involve projectiles that can be blocked by certain abilities.
Kayle is commonly played in the top lane due to her scaling and solo-lane carry potential.
Kayle's E, Starfire Spellblade, deals bonus damage proportionate to the target's missing health.
Kayn is a versatile Jungler, capable of ganking and scaling through his unique form transformation.
Kayn's Shadow Step (E) grants him high mobility by allowing him to move through terrain.
Kayn's Darkin form abilities (Reaping Slash and Umbral Trespass) deal damage based on a target's maximum health.
Kayn's Darkin form Blade's Reach (W) knocks up enemies.
Kayn, particularly in Darkin form, has high sustain through his passive healing from spell damage and healing from Shadow Step (E).
As a champion with High Sustain, Kayn is significantly weakened by Grievous Wounds.
Kennen is commonly played as an AP champion in the Top lane due to his ranged harassment and powerful ultimate.
Kennen's Lightning Rush (E) grants him significant movement speed, allowing for quick engagements and escapes.
Kennen relies on Lightning Rush for mobility and engagement, making him vulnerable to anti-dash abilities that can stop his movement.
Kennen's primary poke and Mark of the Storm application often rely on his Thundering Shuriken (Q), which can be blocked by projectile shields.
Kha'Zix is an Assassin champion typically played in the Jungle role due to his strong isolation damage against jungle monsters and gank potential.
Kha'Zix's Void Assault (R) makes him invisible for a short duration, enhancing his stealth and ganking capabilities.
Kha'Zix's Leap (E) provides high mobility for engages and escapes, with its cooldown resetting on champion takedowns when evolved.
Kha'Zix's evolved Void Spike (W) reveals enemy champions hit for 2 seconds.
Kha'Zix relies on his Leap (E) for engagement and repositioning, making him vulnerable to anti-dash abilities that can interrupt his movements.
Kindred's kit and ally tips suggest a primary role in the jungle, focusing on clearing camps and securing marks.
Kindred's W passive, Wolf's Frenzy, provides health restoration based on missing health, contributing to sustain.
Kindred's E, Mounting Dread, deals bonus missing health physical damage with Wolf's pounce.
Kindred's Wolf's Frenzy passive provides healing, making her vulnerable to Grievous Wounds.
Kled is a fighter/tank champion commonly played in the top lane.
Kled's Bear Trap on a Rope (Q) applies Grievous Wounds to hooked enemies.
Kled has two dashes with Jousting (E) and a long-range charge with Chaaaaaaaarge!!! (R).
Skaarl's ram at the end of Chaaaaaaaarge!!! (R) briefly Knocks Back enemies.
Champions with high mobility like Kled are vulnerable to abilities that stop or punish dashes.
Kled gains a shield during Chaaaaaaaarge!!! (R), making him vulnerable to Shield Reave effects.
Kog'Maw is primarily played as a Marksman in the Bot lane.
Bio-Arcane Barrage (W) allows Kog'Maw's attacks to deal percent of target's maximum health as magic damage.
Living Artillery (R) reveals enemies hit for 2 seconds.
Kog'Maw lacks good escape abilities, making him especially prone to ganks from high mobility champions.
Kog'Maw's primary damage output relies on his auto-attacks, which are projectiles and can be blocked.
LeBlanc is primarily played in the Mid lane.
Distortion (W) allows LeBlanc to dash to a location and return, providing high mobility.
Ethereal Chains (E) grants True Sight on shackled enemies.
Mirror Image (Passive) grants LeBlanc invisibility when her health is low.
LeBlanc's high mobility from Distortion (W) makes her vulnerable to anti-dash abilities that can lock her down.
LeBlanc's Sigil of Malice (Q) and Ethereal Chains (E) are projectiles, making her weak to abilities that block projectiles.
Lee Sin is primarily played in the jungle due to his strong early game ganks and jungle clear provided by abilities like Safeguard's sustain on neutral monsters.
Sonic Wave (Q1) grants True Sight of the first enemy hit.
Iron Will (W2) provides significant Life Steal and Spell Vamp for 4 seconds, enabling strong sustain.
Lee Sin has multiple dashes with Resonating Strike (Q2) and Safeguard (W1), providing high mobility for engages and escapes.
Dragon's Rage (R) knocks back the primary target and knocks up any enemies the target collides with.
Lee Sin's sustain from Iron Will (W2) can be significantly countered by Grievous Wounds effects.
Lee Sin heavily relies on his dashes (Q2, W1) for engagement, repositioning, and escaping, making him vulnerable to abilities that stop or restrict dashes.
Leona's kit provides strong crowd control and tankiness for the Support role.
Leona's Zenith Blade (E) allows her to dash to an enemy champion.
Leona's Zenith Blade dash can be interrupted or stopped by Anti-Dash mechanics.
Lillia's kit is well-suited for clearing jungle camps and ganking lanes with her movement speed and crowd control.
Lillia's passive, Dream-Laden Bough, deals additional max Health damage over time to champions and monsters.
Lillia's Q, Blooming Blows, grants stacking movement speed upon hitting enemies with abilities.
Lillia relies on her high movement speed to navigate fights, making her vulnerable to effects that stop or limit movement within an area, as per the 'High Mobility -> Weak to Anti-Dash' rule.
Lissandra is classified as a Mage, a role typically played in the Mid lane.
Lissandra's Glacial Path (E) allows her to teleport a significant distance, providing her with high mobility.
Lissandra's primary mobility spell, Glacial Path (E), can be interrupted or negated by Anti-Dash effects, leaving her vulnerable.
Lucian is a Marksman, commonly played in the Bot lane.
Lucian has a dash ability, Relentless Pursuit (E), and gains movement speed from Ardent Blaze (W).
Lucian's Ardent Blaze (W) briefly reveals enemies, providing true sight.
Lucian's High Mobility makes him vulnerable to Anti-Dash abilities that can lock him down.
Lulu's primary role is Support
Help, Pix! grants True Sight on an enemy champion
Wild Growth knocks up nearby enemies
Whimsy grants a significant move speed buff to allies, including herself
Whimsy polymorphs enemies, preventing them from attacking
Whimsy polymorphs enemies, preventing them from using movement abilities or dashes
Lulu provides shields with Help, Pix!
Lux is commonly played in the Support role due to her crowd control, shielding, and zone control abilities.
Lux's Prismatic Barrier provides shields, which can be negated by champions with Shield Reave abilities.
Lux's core abilities, Light Binding, Lucent Singularity, and Final Spark, are all projectiles or skillshots that can be blocked or intercepted.
Malphite is commonly played in the Top lane.
Unstoppable Force makes Malphite immune to crowd control during his ultimate dash.
Unstoppable Force knocks up all enemies in its target area.
Ground Slam reduces the attack speed of nearby enemies.
Unstoppable Force provides a high-speed dash to a target location.
Malphite's Granite Shield passive makes him vulnerable to Shield Reave mechanics.
Malphite's primary engagement tool, Unstoppable Force, is a dash, making him susceptible to Anti-Dash abilities.
Malzahar is a mage champion primarily played in the Mid lane.
Malzahar's passive, Void Shift, grants him crowd control immunity.
Malzahar's ultimate, Nether Grasp, creates a zone of negative energy around his target that deals percent max Health magic damage.
Maokai is primarily played as a Tank in the Top lane due to his durability and crowd control.
Maokai's passive, Sap Magic, provides significant healing on a short cooldown, contributing to high sustain.
Maokai's Q, Bramble Smash, knocks back nearby enemies.
Maokai's W, Twisted Advance, roots the target, and his R, Nature's Grasp, roots enemies, effectively stopping dashes.
Maokai's E, Sapling Toss, deals magic damage based on the target's max health.
Maokai's high sustain from Sap Magic makes him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds effects.
Master Yi is primarily played as a Jungler.
Highlander grants Master Yi a significant movement speed boost, and Alpha Strike provides quick dashes/teleports.
Meditate restores a substantial amount of Master Yi's health, especially when he is low.
Highlander makes Master Yi immune to all slowing effects.
Alpha Strike makes Master Yi untargetable during its cast, allowing him to dodge incoming attacks.
Due to his High Sustain from Meditate, Master Yi is weak to Grievous Wounds which reduces his healing.
Miss Fortune is a Marksman, primarily played in the Bot lane.
Her Strut (W) passive grants significant bonus Move Speed when not taking damage.
Her ultimate, Bullet Time, and her Q, Double Up, are projectile-based abilities that can be blocked.
Her Strut (W) provides high movement speed, making her vulnerable to abilities that can stop or prevent her movement.
Wukong is a fighter/tank champion commonly played in the Top lane.
Wukong is a fighter/tank champion commonly played in the Jungle role.
Warrior Trickster (W) grants Wukong invisibility.
Nimbus Strike (E) and Warrior Trickster (W) provide Wukong with high mobility through dashes.
Cyclone (R) allows Wukong to knock up nearby enemies.
Cyclone (R) deals percent max health physical damage.
Wukong's reliance on dashes from Nimbus Strike and Warrior Trickster makes him weak to Anti-Dash mechanics.
Mordekaiser is a Fighter champion typically played in the Top lane.
Mordekaiser's W (Indestructible) allows him to heal by consuming his shield.
Mordekaiser relies on his W for sustain, making him vulnerable to healing reduction effects.
Morgana is often played as a support champion due to her utility spells.
Black Shield grants temporary immunity to crowd control for an ally.
Tormented Shadow deals increased damage based on the target's missing health.
Morgana's Black Shield can be countered by champions with Shield Reave mechanics.
Morgana's Dark Binding, a key ability, can be blocked by projectile blocking abilities.
Nami is designated as a Support champion in her tags.
Nami's Ebb and Flow (W) is a core healing ability that sustains allies, making her kit revolve around healing.
Nami's ultimate ability, Tidal Wave (R), knocks up enemies.
As a champion with High Sustain, Nami is weak to Grievous Wounds.
Nasus is primarily played in the Top lane due to his scaling, sustain, and tankiness.
Nasus's passive, Soul Eater, grants him bonus Life Steal, providing high sustain.
Nasus's ultimate, Fury of the Sands, deals magic damage based on the enemy's maximum health.
Nasus's high sustain from Soul Eater makes him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds effects.
Nasus is prone to being kited by champions with high mobility due to his lack of reliable gap closers.
Nautilus is predominantly played as a Support due to his strong engage and crowd control.
Nautilus' ultimate ability, Depth Charge, knocks up enemies.
Nautilus relies on Titan's Wrath for temporary shielding, making him vulnerable to abilities that reave shields.
Neeko is tagged as a Support champion.
Neeko is tagged as a Mage champion, often played in the Mid lane.
Neeko's W (Shapesplitter) makes her invisible and creates a clone.
Neeko's W (Shapesplitter) passive grants bonus movement speed, and its active grants bonus movement speed to Neeko and her clone.
Neeko's ultimate (Pop Blossom) grants her a shield, making her weak to shield reave effects.
Neeko's Q (Blooming Burst) and E (Tangle-Barbs) are both projectiles, making her weak to projectile block abilities.
Nidalee excels in jungle clearing and ganking due to her shapeshifting abilities and mobility.
Nidalee's Pounce in cougar form and her Prowl passive provide her with significant mobility, especially in brush and when hunting targets.
Nidalee's Primal Surge (human form E) provides a substantial heal to herself and allies, contributing to her sustain.
Nidalee's passive Prowl grants True Sight on targets marked as 'Hunted' by Javelin Toss or Bushwhack.
Nidalee's Bushwhack traps deal magic damage based on the victim's current Health over time.
Nidalee's Primal Surge heal can be significantly reduced by Grievous Wounds effects.
Nidalee's primary engage and escape tool, Pounce (cougar W), is a dash that can be interrupted or blocked by anti-dash abilities.
Nocturne's kit, including strong jungle clear and a global ultimate for ganking, makes him a primary Jungler.
Shroud of Darkness (W) creates a magical barrier that blocks a single enemy ability, including projectiles.
Paranoia (R) allows Nocturne to dash to an enemy champion from a long range, providing high mobility for engages.
Nocturne's primary engagement and gap-closer is his ultimate's dash (Paranoia), which can be countered by anti-dash abilities.
Nunu & Willump is a common jungle champion due to his clearing speed and ganking potential.
Nunu's Q, Consume, provides significant self-healing, especially in the jungle.
Nunu's W, Biggest Snowball Ever!, knocks up enemies upon collision.
Nunu's High Sustain from Consume is countered by Grievous Wounds.

Olaf's ultimate ability, Ragnarok, makes him immune to disables.
Olaf's Berserker Rage passive and Vicious Strikes (W) provide significant healing, especially at low health.
Olaf's high sustain is directly countered by Grievous Wounds effects.

Ornn's Bellows Breath (W) and Brittle effect deal percent max health magic damage.

Poppy's W (Steadfast Presence) stops enemy dashes in its area.
Poppy's R (Keeper's Verdict) uncharged swing knocks up enemies.

Qiyana's ultimate, Supreme Display of Talent (R), deals max health physical damage.
Qiyana's primary damage ability, Edge of Ixtal (Q), is a projectile that can be blocked.

Quinn's ultimate, Behind Enemy Lines, grants significant movement speed, and her W passive provides temporary movement speed boosts.

Quinn's E, Vault, causes her to leap off a target, slightly knocking them back and interrupting them.
Quinn's Q, Blinding Assault, reduces the vision radius of enemies, effectively blinding them and making auto-attacks less reliable, and disarms non-champions.
Champions with high mobility like Quinn are vulnerable to abilities that can stop or prevent dashes.

Rakan's Grand Entrance (W) knocks up nearby enemies on arrival.
Rakan has high mobility through his Battle Dance (E) dashes to allies and The Quickness (R) grants significant move speed.
Rakan's passive (Fey Feathers) and Battle Dance (E) provide shields, making him vulnerable to Shield Reave effects.

Rek'Sai is an apex predator that tunnels to ambush prey, fitting the Jungler playstyle.

Rek'Sai's ultimate, Void Rush, deals damage based on the target's missing health.

Rell's W (Ferromancy: Crash Down) knocks up enemies.

Renata Glasc's primary role is Support, as indicated by her tags.

Slice and Dice allows Renekton to dash, and recast for a second dash upon hitting an enemy.

Rengar is primarily played in the jungle role due to his ganking potential and burst damage.

Rengar's ultimate, Thrill of the Hunt, grants him camouflage.

Blood Hunt (W) grants Warwick increased movement speed towards low health enemies, and Infinite Duress (R) is a long-range leap.
Jaws of the Beast (Q) deals magic damage based on the target's maximum health.
Warwick's primary healing from his Q, R, and passive is significantly reduced by Grievous Wounds.
Xayah is a Marksman, which typically plays in the Bot lane.
Xayah's Featherstorm (R) makes her untargetable, allowing her to ignore incoming crowd control.
Xayah's Deadly Plumage (W) grants her movement speed when attacking champions.
Xayah's damage kit relies heavily on projectiles (daggers and feathers), making her weak to champions with projectile blocking abilities.
Xayah's high mobility from Deadly Plumage (W) makes her vulnerable to anti-dash abilities that can restrict her movement.
Xerath is a long-range mage who typically plays in the mid lane to control the map with his artillery spells.
Xerath's primary damage and crowd control abilities (Arcanopulse, Shocking Orb, Rite of the Arcane) are all projectiles and can be blocked by abilities like Yasuo's Wind Wall.
Xin Zhao's tags are Fighter and Assassin, making him primarily played in the Jungle role.
Xin Zhao's Three Talon Strike (Q) knocks an opponent into the air.
Xin Zhao's Crescent Guard (R) deals damage based on the enemy's current Health.
Yasuo is commonly played in the Mid lane.
Yasuo's Steel Tempest (Q) fires a whirlwind that knocks enemies Airborne.
Yasuo's Wind Wall (W) blocks all enemy projectiles.
Yasuo's Sweeping Blade (E) provides high mobility through rapid dashes.
Yasuo's passive, Way of the Wanderer, grants him a shield, making him vulnerable to Shield Reave.
Yone is commonly played in the Mid lane due to his assassin/fighter playstyle.
Yone's Mortal Steel (Q) and Fate Sealed (R) abilities both knock up enemies.
Yone's Spirit Cleave (W) ability deals damage based on the target's maximum health.
Yone's Soul Unbound (E) ability grants him significant movement speed and allows him to reposition.
As a high mobility champion who relies on dashes, Yone is vulnerable to abilities that can stop or prevent his dashes.
Yorick is primarily played in the Top lane due to his strong dueling, split-pushing, and lane control capabilities.
Yorick's Last Rites (Q) restores health, especially when he is below 50% health, providing significant sustain in lane and fights.
Yorick's Mourning Mist (E) deals magic damage based on the target's current health.
Yorick's Dark Procession (W) summons a destructible wall that blocks enemy movement, effectively stopping dashes within its area.
Yorick relies on the healing from his Last Rites (Q) for sustain, making him vulnerable to effects that reduce healing.
Yuumi's tags indicate her primary role is Support.
Yuumi's E ability (Zoomies) provides significant healing to herself or her attached ally, and her passive (Bop 'n' Block) grants a shield.
Yuumi's W ability (You and Me!) allows her to dash to and attach to allies, making her highly mobile when repositioning.
While attached to an ally via her W ability (You and Me!), Yuumi becomes untargetable to enemies, effectively making her immune to most forms of crowd control.
Yuumi's healing from Zoomies (E) and passive shields make her vulnerable to effects that reduce healing.
Yuumi's passive ability (Bop 'n' Block) grants shields, making her vulnerable to abilities that destroy shields.
Zac is commonly played as a Jungler due to his strong ganks and sustain.
Zac restores health by reabsorbing goo chunks from his passive Cell Division and his abilities.
Zac's W, Unstable Matter, deals magic damage based on a percentage of nearby enemies' maximum health.
Zac's Q (Stretching Strikes), E (Elastic Slingshot), and R (Let's Bounce!) all provide knock-ups.
Zac's E, Elastic Slingshot, is a long-range dash, and his R, Let's Bounce!, provides movement speed.
Due to his high sustain from Cell Division, Zac is weak to Grievous Wounds.
Zac's main engagement tool, Elastic Slingshot (E), can be interrupted by various crowd control, making him weak to anti-dash abilities during its charge.
Zed is an assassin commonly played in the Mid lane.
Living Shadow (W) provides Zed with significant mobility for positioning and escapes.
Death Mark (R) makes Zed untargetable during his initial dash, allowing him to ignore incoming crowd control and damage.
Zed's reliance on dashes for engagement and escape makes him vulnerable to champions with anti-dash abilities.
Zed's primary damage ability, Razor Shuriken (Q), is a projectile and can be blocked by certain abilities.
Zeri's tag is Marksman, which is commonly played in the Bot lane.
Zeri's passive, Living Battery, allows her to absorb energy from enemy shields, shielding herself.
Zeri's Q, Burst Fire, deals bonus magic damage based on the enemy's maximum health when fully charged.
Zeri's E, Spark Surge, is a dash ability, and her R, Lightning Crash, grants stacking movement speed.
Zeri's primary damage source (Q, Burst Fire) and W (Ultrashock Laser) are projectile-based abilities.
Zeri's passive, Living Battery, causes her to gain shields, making her vulnerable to shield reave effects.
Zeri relies on her E, Spark Surge, for mobility, making her vulnerable to abilities that stop dashes.
Ziggs is typically played in the Mid lane as a mage due to his long-range poke and zone control.
Ziggs can be played in the Bot lane as an Ability Power Carry due to his wave clear and ability to quickly take down turrets.
Ziggs' Satchel Charge (W) knocks enemies away, functioning as a form of displacement.
Many of Ziggs' primary damaging abilities, such as Bouncing Bomb (Q) and Mega Inferno Bomb (R), are projectiles and can be blocked by abilities like Wind Wall.
Zilean's primary role is Support, as indicated by his tags.
Zilean's Time Warp (E) ability allows him to gain significant bonus movement speed.
Zoe is a prominent Mage champion commonly played in the Mid lane.
Zoe's champion tags include 'Support', indicating she can be played in this role.
Zoe's Spell Thief (W) grants her significant move speed, and Portal Jump (R) allows her to blink to reposition.
Zoe's primary damage ability, Paddle Star (Q), is a projectile that can be blocked by certain champion abilities.
Zoe's mobility, including her Spell Thief (W) move speed and Portal Jump (R) blink, can be countered by abilities that restrict movement or punish predictable positioning.
Zyra is commonly played as a Support champion, as indicated by her champion tags.
Zyra's Rampant Growth (W) seeds grant True Sight of enemy champions that step on them.
Zyra's Stranglethorns (R) knocks up enemies after expanding.
